member.name: M:RepoDb.BaseRepository`2.CreateConnection(System.Boolean)

member.returns: An instance of the object.

member.name: M:RepoDb.BaseRepository`2.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the current repository instance. It is not necessary to call this method if the value of the property is equals to . This method only manages the connection persistency for the repositories where the value of the property is equals to .

member.name: F:RepoDb.Enumerations.ConversionType.Automatic
member.summary: The data type conversion is not strict. An additional logic from object will be used to properly map the data type into its destination .NET CLR type. The operation will only succeed if the data types are convertible.

member.name: T:RepoDb.Interfaces.ITrace
member.summary: An interface used to mark a class to be usable for tracing operations. A trace object is being used by the repositories on every operations (before or after) the actual execution. It provides the flexibility of the operations to be traceable and debuggable. The caller can modify the SQL Statements or the parameters being passed prior the actual execution, or even cancel the prior-execution.

member.name: T:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints
member.summary: A class that contains the SQL Server table hints (query optimizers) when querying a record. See Microsoft documentation here.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.NoExpand
member.summary: Specifies that any indexed views are not expanded to access underlying tables when the query optimizer processes the query.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ForceSeek
member.summary: The query optimizer considers only index seek operations to access the table or view through any relevant index.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ForceScan
member.summary: Specifies that the query optimizer use only an index scan operation as the access path to the referenced table or view.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.HoldLock
member.summary: HOLDLOCK applies only to the table or view for which it is specified and only for the duration of the transaction defined by the statement that it is used in. Is equivalent to SERIALIZABLE.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.NoLock
member.summary: Specifies that dirty reads are allowed. No shared locks are issued to prevent other transactions from modifying data read by the current transaction, and exclusive locks set by other transactions do not block the current transaction from reading the locked data. Is equivalent to READUNCOMMITTED.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.NoWait
member.summary: Instructs the Database Engine to return a message as soon as a lock is encountered on the table.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.PagLock
member.summary: Takes page locks either where individual locks are ordinarily taken on rows or keys, or where a single table lock is ordinarily taken.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Specifies that read operations comply with the rules for the READ COMMITTED isolation level by using either locking or row versioning.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ReadCommittedLock
member.summary: Specifies that read operations comply with the rules for the READ COMMITTED isolation level by using locking.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ReadPast
member.summary: Specifies that the Database Engine not read rows that are locked by other transactions.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: Specifies that dirty reads are allowed. No shared locks are issued to prevent other transactions from modifying data read by the current transaction, and exclusive locks set by other transactions do not block the current transaction from reading the locked data.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Specifies that a scan is performed with the same locking semantics as a transaction running at REPEATABLE READ isolation level.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.RowLock
member.summary: Specifies that row locks are taken when page or table locks are ordinarily taken. When specified in transactions operating at the SNAPSHOT isolation level, row locks are not taken unless ROWLOCK is combined with other table hints that require locks, such as UPDLOCK and HOLDLOCK.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.Serializable
member.summary: Makes shared locks more restrictive by holding them until a transaction is completed, instead of releasing the shared lock as soon as the required table or data page is no longer needed, whether the transaction has been completed or not. The scan is performed with the same semantics as a transaction running at the SERIALIZABLE isolation level. Is equivalent to HOLDLOCK.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.Snapshot
member.summary: The memory-optimized table is accessed under SNAPSHOT isolation. SNAPSHOT can only be used with memory-optimized tables (not with disk-based tables). Applies to: SQL Server 2014 (12.x) through SQL Server 2017.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.TabLock
member.summary: Specifies that the acquired lock is applied at the table level. The type of lock that is acquired depends on the statement being executed.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.TabLockX
member.summary: Specifies that an exclusive lock is taken on the table.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.UpdLock
member.summary: Specifies that update locks are to be taken and held until the transaction completes.

member.name: F:RepoDb.SqlServerTableHints.XLock
member.summary: Specifies that exclusive locks are to be taken and held until the transaction completes.
